intro: Geonoma rupestris, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, often holding water. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, emerging from the center of the leaf rosette. Geonoma rupestris is often found growing on rocks or in shaded, moist environments, showcasing its adaptability to diverse ecological niches.
